fields.description: We have a user in our JIRA directory that all of a sudden was member of the jira-adminstrator group. While we could not figure out how he got that membership we tried to remove him from the group. It does not work. We cannot remove the group jira-administrators from his user groups. You can remove the group out of the list, save, but he still remains member of that group.
fields.summary: Cannot remove user from group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27749].
  {panel}

When clicking change assignee the default selector is a simple drop down list. This is not very good compared to for example to selector used when selecting Reporter when doing simple searches.

Please add an option (preferably both client and global) OR change the default selector to be the better one, which is used for example when selecting Components or when doing a search in simple mode and selecting Reporter.

Example:
We currently have many users starting with Bjorn and you want to select Bjorn Bengtsson, you will have to type BJOR then space to bring up the whole list then use the arrow keys. A much easier and better way would be to just type BENG and it would select Bjorn Bengtsson.
fields.summary: Better Change Assignee Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27746].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
Go to any frother issue picker (link issue for example)
1. Type the full key of an issue you know exists.
2. Wait for the dropdown to appear with only that issue in it
3. Click away with your mouse
4. Click okay/link

The request that is sent has two of the same issuekey.

Noticed this when trying to use frother issue picker for Bonfire.
fields.summary: Sometimes Frother Issue picker sends the same issuekey twice

fields.description:
see CONFDEV-7543

Basically the default set of gadgets in JIRA will show up in squashed iframes in Confluence. From what I could tell, the main reason for this is that the gadget in Confluence uses the xml files (found at jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/gadgets/*.xml) to build the gadget.

The thing which seems to be causing the squashing is the height=100 which should be 300 instead (at least it should be 300 for the gadgets I have tried. Some gadgets might require a different height).
fields.summary: all gadgets on this page have horizontally squashed frames
Exception thrown from custom field breaks REST API
Make the new limit for text fields limitable, by default OFF and configurable on the advanced config page

fields.description:
In looking at the Jira Rest documentation you should be able to pass the expand= parameter to the search API. The expected result would be that the search would return the issues with the node expanded. For example I would expect the following to return the changelog along with the default fields.

/jira/rest/api/2/search?expand=changelog&startAt=0&jql=project='IT'%20and%20assignee='pmorton'

The above search does not resturn a changelog node in the JSON, however if I request the same fields on an individual issue, I get the expected result (change log node in the JSON). i.e /jira/rest/api/2/issue/17780?expand=changelog works as expected.

So the summary is that a search is not expanding the expandable field that I request it to using the API.
fields.summary: /search? REST not expanding nodes
On the jira "add user to groups" page, put the Join button on the top as well as the bottom of the groups list.

fields.description:
*Summary:*
When you delete a group that has been used to limit the visibility of comments, you're given the option to choose another group to make those comments visible to.

When you delete a role that has been used to limit the visibility of comments, no prompt is given.  The role is removed and the comments are still flagged as being visible to users associated with the missing role.  These comments are effectively orphaned.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create an issue comment and restrict it to a specific role
# Delete the role
*Result:* Comment is invisible, orphaned in the database.
*Expected:* either
* when deleting the role an option to move comments to another role is done or to make them public.
* comments are made accessible to administrators role

*Workaround:*
Perform a database update as mentioned on [How to recover the comments viewable by a Project Role which has been deleted|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/how-to-recover-the-comments-viewable-by-a-project-role-which-has-been-deleted-308609475.html]
fields.summary: Deleting a role leaves private comments in an unusable state....

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27724].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA 5 already allows to import mails from a local directory. 
This import however does not recurse through subfolders nor does it recognize a maildir structure which is used by the MTA to deliver the mails to the filesystem on which JIRA resides. In this case it would have to look into the .cur and .new subdirectories to find the mails.
A further benefit of maildir support wouold be, that messages can be properly flagged as 'seen' or 'deleted' very much like on an IMAP connection.

Another nice to have feature would be to also allow "forwarding" of handled messages and error messages to sub-maildirs (e.g. 'handled' and 'error') of the import directory.

The JavaMaildir library could be used to provide a mailserver-like interface to maildirs: http://javamaildir.sourceforge.net/

We had implemented this as a plugin in JIRA 4.x, but with the massive changes in mail handling in JIRA 5 (no configuration of mail fetching services anymore) this no longer works.
fields.summary: Add proper maildir support for mail import

fields.description:
Comment is not entirely collapse if List Wiki Markup is used

Steps to reproduce:
# ensure that Comment is using Wiki Text renderer
# add a comment to an issue. For example:
{quote}
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, nisl conubia at, luctus sed, urna nam sit. Pellentesque diam arcu, sed tincidunt, consectetuer tellus. Per viverra. Nibh amet faucibus, ipsum massa, convallis aut nullam. Elit vel neque, nec purus, auctor in. Eget nisl, leo sagittis, ornare non.
{quote}
# add another comment using the following:
{noformat}
Maecenas felis, egestas justo volutpat. Duis hendrerit rutrum, suspendisse aliquam. Pede sit, turpis at porta, magna fames. Tincidunt at pretium. Eget suscipit elementum.

# Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, nisl conubia at, luctus sed, urna nam sit. Pellentesque diam arcu, sed tincidunt, consectetuer tellus. Per viverra. Nibh amet faucibus, ipsum massa, convallis aut nullam. Elit vel neque, nec purus, auctor in. Eget nisl, leo sagittis, ornare non.
# Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, nisl conubia at, luctus sed, urna nam sit. Pellentesque diam arcu, sed tincidunt, consectetuer tellus. Per viverra. Nibh amet faucibus, ipsum massa, convallis aut nullam. Elit vel neque, nec purus, auctor in. Eget nisl, leo sagittis, ornare non.

Nisl mollis. Aliqua sollicitudin, risus aliquam, suspendisse vehicula eros. Imperdiet sed, maecenas vestibulum. Placerat imperdiet neque. Diamlorem sapien, pellentesque elit, eget pede fames. Ut sed, ut wisi, lorem risus. Feugiat volutpat.
{noformat}
# collapse the comment, and the listed content will be displayed as per screenshot JIRA50-Collapse.png

Attached are other screenshot to display the issue. 

This is tested against JIRA 4.4.4 and JIRA 5.0. Problem only reproducible in JIRA 5.0.
fields.summary: Comment is not entirely collapse if List Wiki Markup is used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27722].
  {panel}

Hi,

It would be nice to define the counter value to start the issue Ids when importing a project.

For example, while importing a project from test instance to production instance, a user might want the issue keys to start from TST-1000 instead of TST-1. Currently this is not possible with out manually tweaking the database or the XML backup.


Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Allow modifying Issue numbering while using XML import

fields.description:
In this version of JIRA, if you perform a search for "Tempo Plugin" for example, the entire list of PAC plugins will be retrieved, with several of them not being relevant to the search performed.

In the previous versions, it would retrieve only the relevant plugins. Were any changes performed on this lately?

Thanks!

Cheers,
Clarissa.

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA that results from the way third-party XML parsers are used in JIRA. This vulnerability allows an attacker who is an authenticated JIRA user to execute denial of service attacks against the JIRA server.

All versions of JIRA up to and including 5.0.0 are affected.

Full details of the severity, risks and vulnerability can be found in the *[JIRA Security Advisory 2012-05-17|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2012-05-17]*.
fields.summary: XML Vulnerability in JIRA

fields.description:
Hi,

I was looking a customer issue ([JSP-122240|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-122240]) and discover a bug on JIRA.

How to replicate:
- Create a clean JIRA instance;
- create two users (Administrator - login admin / User 1 - login user)
- Create a new project (e.g. Project X - PX);
- Create 4 issues (PX-1, PX-2, PX-3, PX-4);
- Assign one issue (PX-2) for the user User 1 and the others for the Administrator;

Try the following queries:

* project=PX AND assignee was "admin"
** response: 4 issues

* project=PX AND assignee = "admin"
** response: 3 issues

* project=PX AND assignee = "Administrator"
** response: 3 issues

* project=PX AND assignee was "Administrator"
** response: No matching issues found.

The last query supposed to bring 4 issues, like the first one, but looks like the operator WAS just work with the _Username_ and not with the _Full Name_.


Cheers,
Andre Petry
Atlassian Support

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27691].
  {panel}

For example, 

# Create a user on the JIRA instance named *admin*
# Create two users on your SVN server.  Ie. *admin* and *ADMIN*
** I use Visual SVN for this example, and create the two users.  These users are different since Visual SVN is case sensitive 
# Do a commit test for the user *admin*
# Do a commit test for the user *ADMIN*
# Access JIRA under *admin* and go to the user's profile activity stream.
** The activity stream will treat the user *ADMIN* and *admin* differently.  
!activitystream.png!

As you can see from the screen shot, *admin* and *ADMIN*'s commits fall under two different users.  It would be nice to have an option to force username to lower case so that the commits will fall under one single user.  This feature is similar that is offered in FishEye.  
!usernames.png!

By enabling the force to lower case option, the activity on the FishEye instance will fall under one user.  
!FishEye.png!

This way, all the commits on the activity stream will be under the one user (in this case, admin), not two different users.
fields.summary: Inconsistency between users (committers) on the profile activity stream

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27665].
  {panel}

We are using direct links to the jira web interface from our applications for quicker error reporting. Some fields, especially the project and environment are filled in already, which makes life of our testers a lot easier, because we collect a lot of environment information (plugin revision number, host software and version, operating system, machine specs, graphics card model and driver version, etc.) which is otherwise a pain to have ready always.

Also using the REST Api is a big issue, because we'd have to add http support, json processing, etc. to our plugins, while using OS calls to bring up a browser with these infos encoded in the url is really easy.

So this is great, the only thing that is a little bit of a nuisance is that for people having the "change reporter" permission, the reporter is set to nobody by default. Storing the Jira user name in our plugin just so we can put it into the url seems a little bit wasteful, but if we don't pass it, the user has to put it there manually, even though he just logged in.

If calling a URL directly without user name could default to the logged in user or if there were a magic number that sets the field to the currently logged in user, this would make our experience perfect. The Assignee field for example can be set to automatic by passing assignee=-1.
fields.summary: Allow the reporter field to be set to the person logged in when directly linking to an issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Restarting Jira with the jira.clone.prefix value set to bank causes it to reset to the default value on Oracle databases

h3. Environment
* Any supported Oracle database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira using Oracle database.
 # Go to Jira Administration > System, General Configuration, button _Advanced Settings_ (upper right corner) and modify the value of the jira.clone.prefix to a _single space_
 # Restart JIRA

h3. Expected Results
 * The clone prefix key value remains as it was before the restart.

h3. Actual Results
 * The _jira.clone.prefix_ key value is reset to "CLONE -"

h3. Workarounds
 # Using another of the supported platforms database.
 # Create a file with the name "jira-config.properties" at JIRA_HOME and specifie the "jira.clone.prefix" property as follows:
{code:java}
jira.clone.prefix={code}
# An space can be indicated as the value instead of and empty value, which will be accepted and will not be reset after the restart.

h3. Notes
 * If the value is changed it will work as expected until the instance is restarted.
 * In more recent versions (Jira 7.11+) Jira will not accept _empty_ as a valid value and will instead revert to the default "CLONE -" immediately.
fields.summary: Setting jira.clone.prefix to blank is reset to the default value upon restart on Oracle databases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27660].
  {panel}

As a global JIRA admin, I can configure default project dashboards, which get automatically added to a project member on project creation and/or project member change, so that my users can see the status of all their projects without manual interaction.

h1.BACKGROUND
In our organization, users usually are working on a set of short to mid term projects. Hence new projects get created regularly and users get added or removed regularly.

The desire is to have a common default dashboard, which reports the project status in the scope of the respective project, which does not require manual configuration. On project creation, this dashboard should be automatically made available based on a central template and should get pushed to all current and future project members.

Users would see dashboards for all the projects, they are assigned to after directly after login, without the need of manually adding/configuring a dashboard.

h1.SCOPE OUTLINE
- Create and maintain auto-dashboard templates per project type in the admin interface. Potentially multiple auto-dashboards (e.g. one with a general overview, one focused on defects)
- Auto-Dashboard templates are based on the "standard" dashboard gadgets
- The gadgets are based on filters, which ignore any project context.
- If an auto-dashboard is added to the dashboards for a user, he context of the affected project is automatically added to the underlying filters
- When a user gets added to a project, the auto-dashboard will be added to the favourite dashboards. If he gets removed, the auto-dashboard also gets removed
- Users can opt-out of these dashboards.
fields.summary: Define default project dashboards and add them to project members

Please look at the following screenshot sequentially:
!screen1.png|thumbnail!
!screen2.png|thumbnail!
!screen3.png|thumbnail!
Notice the customfield TEXT FIELD has a default value when issue type Bug selected first

If we change the Issue Type option from Bug -> New Feature (don't have customfield) -> Bug, the default value for TEXT FIELD is gone. 

*Expected Behaviour*: The default value for customfield should be retain although we change the Issue Type back and forth.

how can I make only certain resolution options visible in the drop down when I pick a change a status of a jira issue

I would like to have certain resolutions to be associated to certain workflow status. can you add a way to restrict certain resolutions based on the workflow status. 

When I go from open to in progress Status I only want certain resolution options to be visible in the drop down and then when I go from in progress to resolve the issue, there are only a few possible resolution options I need to be visible. 

I have a total of 24 resolution options visible in my Resolutions drop down but I only need 10 to be visible from when I change the open issue to in progress status, 4 resolution options to be visible when I go from in progress to resolved status and then 8 to be selectable when I close an issue and 2 if I need to reopen an issue, is there any way I can do this.
fields.summary: view certain resolutions per workflow status

fields.description:
This is the third weird behaviour customer encounters with the Projects gadgets the last weeks. The behaviour can be reproduced as follows

1. Enter administration mode
2. Edit a project like in the attached screenshot
!Change Name.jpg!
3. Choose a project name without blanks and containing a @
4. Leave the URL empty
5. Exit administration mode
6. Look at the Projects gadget with IE8
7. The project is displayed with an URL, not the project name
!Bug.jpg!

Customer can workaround this by replacing the the @ by something like (at).
fields.summary: In IE 8, "@" sign in project name causes project URL to be displayed in Projects Gadget instead of project name

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Add a date custom field
# Ensure that the database, file encoding and application server are all using the utf-8 encoding as per the guide in [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Internalisation+and+Encoding+Troubleshooting]
# Change the default language of your JIRA instance to French for example
# Choose a sample issue and set the value of the new custom field to "1 February 2012" (in french 1er février 2012)
# Display the updated issue in the navigator
!screenshot-1.jpg|thumbnail!
# click on the view/xml menu
!screenshot-2.jpg|thumbnail!
# The browser displays this error message
!screenshot-3.jpg|thumbnail!

The problem is probably due to the fact that *com.atlassian.jira.datetime.DateTimeVelocityUtils.formatRSS(Date)* method referenced in xml-date.vm does not escape accented characters in a consistent manner.
fields.summary: XML view generates invalid XML for date customfield in languages that use accented characters for the months

fields.description:
we have a JAVA application that's using the REST api on JIRA 4.4.3. I'm testing that Java application on JIRA 5.0.1 (on a testing system, same settings, just did an upgrade).

All is working, but the REST issue get is no longer providing the attachments information:

the rest get call is https://10.116.147.51/jira/rest/api/latest/issue/156510
I've tried with a limited account *and* and admin account, same result. 

According to the API doc in http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id162192, this is the correct call and the example shown in the call shows an example of the attachment JSON block. 

There doesn't seem to be another REST call to access this resource. Am I missing anything or is there an actual issue in JIRA 5.0.1 ?


{panel:title=Resolution| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 
Check to see if the "Attachment" field was is to "Hide" in the default field configuration. There is more information on that found [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Specifying+Field+Behaviour#SpecifyingFieldBehaviour-Modifyingfieldbehaviour]
{panel}
fields.summary: REST issue get no longer shows attachments information

fields.description:
In a comment field:
# Type in a wiki link for a user (e.g. \[~admin\])
# On same line type "something".
# On the same linke type "@a".
# Delete past the "@" into something.
# (BUG) Start typing. JIRA is now trying to query the server on each key press even though there is no username to process. Hitting the ESC will stop the server querying

This is shown in [^mentions.webm].
fields.summary: The comment field can poll the server for users even when no @ symbols need to be processed.

h4. Workaround
1. Use the [Bulk-Edit|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+%28%27Bulk%27%29+Issues] function to first Re-open and then resolve related issues.

or

fields.description:
# Type this comment :"brenden @ this will continue to look for names well after any reasonable time". 

Note that JIRA will continue to poll the server for each character to the end of the sentence. If you continued typing it would continue to poll the server. There is a point where it is clear that @ is not being used to reference a user. In this case we should not be polling the server.
fields.summary: Mentions continues to suggest names indefinately after a @ even though we know we have no matches
